Notes.*: Create a Google optimized chain of words in your URL. Usually you use the title and other keywords. The words are separated with - and are written in lowercase.
This is the date on which the post is published. The post will not be displayed before this date. The date usually also influences the sorting.
This is the main picture shown in the list and in the details. Blog-Post images should be 2x wider than tall, since that's the common share-format. We recommend 2000x1000 pixels.
This is the main image for this article.
Here you can define where the most important area of the image is located. If the image is cropped, this area is made sure to remain in the center and uncropped.

DropdownValues.*:
Top Left:topleft
Top Center:topcenter
Top Right:topright
Middle Left:middleleft
Center:middlecenter
Middle Right:middleright
Bottom Left:bottomleft
Bottom Center:bottomcenter
Bottom Right:bottomright

Notes.*: This is the main content of the blog post.
A category of the post must be selected in each case. Since category names rarely change, new categories can only be added by the site administrator.
Tags help to better classify the blog post and link different posts together.
Optional content - if nothing is specified, title and teaser are used automatically

The following information is required when the post is shared. If you want to know more, you can find more information here: Open Graph. If these fields are empty, other fields (e.g. teaser) will be used automatically.
Max. 140 characters because Twitter would use this description.
Use this function to weight a tag higher, e.g. to display it larger in a tag cloud. 1 is less important than 10.

ShortBio.*: Daniel Mettler grew up in the jungles of Indonesia and is founder and CEO of 2sic internet solutions in Switzerland and Liechtenstein, an 20-head web specialist with over 800 DNN projects since 1999. He is also chief architect of 2sxc (see forge), an open source module for creating attractive content and DNN Apps.
